meanings.sent1: The strong smell of the ammoniac cleaner filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The chemist wore gloves to protect himself from the ammoniac fumes.
meanings.sent3: The cat wrinkled its nose at the pungent odor of the ammoniac solution.
meanings.sent4: The air in the barn was so thick with ammoniac scent, it made her eyes water.
meanings.sent5: The janitor used an ammoniac spray to clean the bathroom thoroughly.

meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too much ammoniac seasoning to the soup.
meanings.sent4: The air in the old house was heavy and ammoniac, reminding her of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The bathroom cleaner was so strong, it almost smelled like pure ammoniac.

meanings.definition: A salt or derivative of ammonia.
meanings.sent1: The scientist mixed the ammoniac with other chemicals to create a new compound.
meanings.sent2: The label on the bottle indicated that it contained an ammoniac compound.
meanings.sent3: The baker added a pinch of ammoniac to the dough for extra fluffiness.
meanings.sent4: The garden fertilizer had an unmistakable scent of ammoniac.
meanings.sent5: The artist used an ammoniac solution to create a unique texture in the painting.
